pullrequest.title: tile_tsv.py: specify artifacts and blockers as 4th field in cell instead of empty cells

content.raw:
Tried it out. Worked for me. This is really nice - before, the blockers were not attached to the tiles after running the script. Now they are.

I don’t know to what extent the files have to stay the same as the original, so I’m not the best judge for that.

I ran PR #106 on the new .tsv file to generate a DOT file and compared the PDFs to the original one, and everything \(tile types and edge costs\) is the same other than the arbitrary vertex indices. I don’t know how important that is. So I’m approving from the standpoint of what I know.
content.html:
Tried it out. Worked for me. This is really nice - before, the blockers were not attached to the tiles after running the script. Now they are.

I don’t know to what extent the files have to stay the same as the original, so I’m not the best judge for that.

I ran PR #106 on the new .tsv file to generate a DOT file and compared the PDFs to the original one, and everything (tile types and edge costs) is the same other than the arbitrary vertex indices. I don’t know how important that is. So I’m approving from the standpoint of what I know.
